questions.question: She worked so …………………… that her health deteriorated.
questions.description: Hard can be an adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He narrated the whole incident in …………………………
She is ……………………… charming.
questions.description: Too has a negative meaning. It is used to talk about unpleasant extremes.

questions.question: I feel …………………….. for her.
questions.description: You feel bad for a person. You need something badly.

questions.question: She drove ………………………..
questions.description: Carefully is the adjective modifying the verb drove.

questions.question: You have …………………….. eaten anything.
questions.description: Hardly means scarcely or almost nothing.

questions.question: Is she getting any ………………………?
questions.description: The comparative form is used when there is an idea of change.

questions.question: She looks …………………………
questions.description: Look is a copular verb we use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: The soup tasted ………………………..
questions.description: Taste is a copular verb we use adjectives to modify copular verbs.
